content: I am a Research Assistant Professor at Old Dominion University’s Commonwealth Cyber Initiative Coastal Virginia, where I explore emerging directions in cybersecurity. Previously, I was a Presidential Postdoctoral Fellow at Virginia Tech. My work spans AI assurance, machine learning for cyberattack detection, and securing cyber-physical systems, with deployments in critical infrastructure including water distribution and agricultural networks.
summary: I am a Research Assistant Professor at Old Dominion University’s Commonwealth Cyber Initiative Coastal Virginia, where I explore emerging directions in cybersecurity. Previously, I was a Presidential Postdoctoral Fellow at Virginia Tech.
title: Nazmul Kabir Sikder

content:
吳恩達 is a professor of artificial intelligence at the Stanford AI Lab. His research interests include distributed robotics, mobile computing and programmable matter. He leads the Robotic Neurobiology group, which develops self-reconfiguring robots, systems of self-organizing robots, and mobile sensor networks.

summary: 吳恩達 is a professor of artificial intelligence at the Stanford AI Lab. His research interests include distributed robotics, mobile computing and programmable matter. He leads the Robotic Neurobiology group, which develops self-reconfiguring robots, systems of self-organizing robots, and mobile sensor networks.
title: 吳恩達

summary: Novel hybrid deep-learning architecture for accurate short-term forecasting in wastewater treatment operations.
title: Context-driven Deep Learning Forecasting for Wastewater Treatment Plants

summary: PhD dissertation on AI-driven anomaly detection methods for critical infrastructure protection in water distribution and agricultural systems.
title: AI Methods for Anomaly Detection in Cyber-Physical Systems: With Application to Water and Agriculture

summary: AI framework for prediction, protection, and optimization of wastewater treatment plant operations.
title: P2O: AI-Driven Framework for Managing and Securing Wastewater Treatment Plants

summary: Comprehensive evaluation of GAN models for generating realistic synthetic datasets to overcome data scarcity in water distribution systems.
title: Assessing the Impact of Cyber Attacks on Water Distribution Systems: A Deep Learning Approach

summary: Deep learning models for detecting concealed cyber attacks in water distribution systems using TGCN and HCAE approaches.
title: Deep H2O: Cyber attacks detection in water distribution systems using deep learning

summary: Comprehensive survey of AI techniques for outlier detection across multiple domains and applications.
title: Outlier detection using AI: a survey

summary: Two model-agnostic AIA pipelines for scoring explainability, safety, and security across domains.
title: Model-Agnostic Scoring Methods for Artificial Intelligence Assurance

summary: Co-authored book on AI assurance frameworks covering trustworthiness, explainability, safety, and ethical considerations.
title: AI Assurance: Towards Trustworthy, Explainable, Safe, and Ethical AI

summary: Real-time AI-driven decision support system (RADS) for cybersecurity, prediction, and optimization in wastewater treatment.
title: Realtime management of wastewater treatment plants using AI

summary: AI2Farm model providing predictions and guidance for agricultural decision-making during conventional and unconventional times.
title: The application of artificial intelligence assurance in precision farming and agricultural economics

summary: Deep learning framework using LSTM networks to predict commodity production considering outlier events' impact on the global economy.
title: DeepAg: Deep Learning Approach for Measuring the Effects of Outlier Events on Agricultural Production and Policy

summary: Investigation of peak demand reduction potential in commercial buildings through HVAC and lighting adjustments in microgrid environments.
title: Quantification of Peak Demand Reduction Potential in Commercial Buildings due to HVAC Set Point and Brightness Adjustment

summary: Comprehensive applications of machine learning techniques in precision agriculture and smart farming systems.
title: Applications of machine learning for precision agriculture and smart farming

summary: Design and implementation of an economical and compact MPPT system using SEPIC converter with Incremental Conductance method.
title: Implementation of microcontroller based Maximum Power Point Tracker (MPPT) using SEPIC converter
